articles.title: Jupiter's moons to supermassive black holes: What will James Webb Telescope observe next? - India Today
articles.description: Astronomers are now excited about the second year of the observatory in space as Cycle-2 begins on July 1.
articles.content: By India Today Science Desk: The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has emerged as the biggest asset Earth has outside the planet. Located at Lagrange Point 2 nearly 15,00,000 kilometers away from the… [+2638 chars]
